NAME: ScummVM current areas of focus
DESC: This page is the current TODO list for ScummVM.

BODY.p: If you want to dig in, this is the place to find out what we're currently working on (or hoping somebody will pick it up for us, you never know). This is the stuff where you might make the most useful contribution, right now. Note that this is never complete, and may be partially outdated, so just because you don't see it here doesn't mean it is not important.

Before you start work on something, you might want to talk to somebody from the team. This will help us to prevent double work, i.e. several people working on the same stuff at once without knowing about each other.
Finally, always make sure to check out our bug tracker and our feature request tracker for things that need work.
Here is a list of things we plan to do for the future. Note that we don't promise to do any of these, nor when we will do them. It's just a list of what we hope to be able to do one day.

ul.li: Music and Sound effects in Indy3Vga
Curse of Monkey Island support (we already have that partially in latest CVS!)

p.b: Rewrite sound code so that the Adlib and MIDI encoders can be active at the same time.

ul.li: This will help in a few cases where games have a few tracks only available in Adlib format
Necessary if we want to allow users to switch between different games at runtime

li.p: Make it possible to restart (scumm) games

Allow the user to choose between multiple video drivers at startup when multiple choices are possible. E.g. between SDL vs. SDL_gl. Just like one can choose a midi driver. Currently one has to recompile for this.
Add a "help" ingame dialog which lists key shortcuts etc.

ul.li: Add tab support (i.e. allow multiple panes in one dialog)
Implement the global preferences dialog (it is already there but nothing is wired)
See also the compatibility page for The DIG
Fix music support, add sound support

li.h4: Indiana Jones and The Last Crusade

ul.li: Fix music support, add sound support
Correctly fix 'missing head' issue (see fixme in actor.cpp)
There are many open bugs for Simon, we really need somebody who can take over maintaining the Simon part of ScummVM
